repositories.brief_summary: Major internal changes including new symbol mangling, unicode comment support, Bool module enhancements, and Windows build fixes
repositories.new_features_summary: New Bool logical functions, unicode identifier support in comments, and improved symbol name mangling consistency
repositories.new_features:
- **Symbol mangling overhaul** changes module names from `camlModule.name_NNN` to `camlModule$name_NNN` with consistent platform encoding ([ccbd123a](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/ccbd123a82e59c710f36097c37b269d4cbbf7c20))
- **Unicode identifier support** in comments allows proper rendering of unicode characters in documentation and code comments ([385ab8f9](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/385ab8f9b9ad8d8dc53a7d2777e35533fc6c93fa), [ccbd123a](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/ccbd123a82e59c710f36097c37b269d4cbbf7c20))
- **Bool module enhancements** with new logical functions `logand`, `logor`, and `logxor` providing explicit Boolean operations ([d23675111](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d23675111673018c5cf51ee07a51df181128df3d))
- **OCaml frame pointer correctness** improvements when using C libraries that don't support frame pointers ([d23675111](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d23675111673018c5cf51ee07a51df181128df3d))
- **Continuation optimization** with faster `caml_continuation_use_and_update_handler_noexc` implementation ([fbe9cedf](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/fbe9cedf020ceedbfc777977fe86346dcec289ff))
- **AMD64 register stall fix** avoiding conversion instruction stalls on amd64 architecture ([d23675111](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d23675111673018c5cf51ee07a51df181128df3d))
- **Cross-compilation support** enhancements with new GitHub workflow for cross-platform builds ([d23675111](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d23675111673018c5cf51ee07a51df181128df3d))
- **Manual improvements** including updated lexical conventions documentation with Unicode support details ([385ab8f9](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/385ab8f9b9ad8d8dc53a7d2777e35533fc6c93fa))
repositories.activity_summary: Single Windows-specific issue opened regarding runtop-with-otherlibs functionality on mingw32 and MSVC targets
repositories.activity:
- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) opened issue about **Windows runtop-with-otherlibs** failing to load otherlibs with Unix module giving "dynamic loading not supported" error ([#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704))
- **Extensive typing system improvements** merged with labeled argument additions to typemod functions by multiple contributors ([d75d775e](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d75d775e0c15bddb2b42685c144abefeeb38012f), [85970ee1](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/85970ee160c13baa89d904dabb00266eb08dc088))
- **Build system modernization** with updated autotools configuration and improved cross-compilation support ([d23675111](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d23675111673018c5cf51ee07a51df181128df3d))
- **Test suite expansion** including new frame pointer tests, Unicode comment tests, and debugger reference updates ([ccbd123a](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/ccbd123a82e59c710f36097c37b269d4cbbf7c20), [385ab8f9](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/385ab8f9b9ad8d8dc53a7d2777e35533fc6c93fa))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on platform consistency, Unicode modernization, and Windows compatibility improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Platform standardization** with consistent symbol mangling across all platforms moving away from platform-specific naming schemes
- **Unicode modernization** progressing with support for Unicode identifiers in comments and updated documentation
- **Windows compatibility focus** addressing longstanding issues with dynamic loading and otherlibs functionality
- **Performance optimization** continuing with targeted improvements in continuation handling and register allocation
- **Type system refinements** with ongoing work on labeled arguments and internal typing infrastructure
repositories.contributors_summary: Multiple contributors including Antonin Décimo, Gabriel Scherer, Hugo Heuzard, and others working on diverse improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) identified and reported Windows runtop-with-otherlibs issue affecting mingw32 and MSVC targets ([#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) contributed to switch optimization work and various typing system improvements ([85970ee1](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/85970ee160c13baa89d904dabb00266eb08dc088))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) implemented continuation optimization based on previous work ([48ecd94a](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/48ecd94a91ca35cbbca2ff9212af0bd0bf580647))
- Multiple contributors worked on the extensive symbol mangling changes, typing system labeled arguments, and Unicode comment support
- Test suite maintainers updated numerous reference files across frame pointers, native debugger, and parsing tests

repositories.brief_summary: Dependency maintenance activity with Nix flake updates and Node.js type definitions, plus new issue on end-to-end testing for custom language servers
repositories.activity_summary: Automated dependency management dominated with four new PRs for flake updates and Node.js type bumps, three subsequently closed
repositories.activity:
- Four **new PRs opened** for dependency updates including Nix flake lock updates by [@github-actions](https://github.com/github-actions) ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1437)) and Node.js type definition bumps by [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) ([#1436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1436), [#1435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1435), [#1434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1434), [#1432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1432))
- **Dependency maintenance** completed with three PRs closed after failing CI or supersession including @swc/core bumps ([#1434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1434), [#1432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1432)) and @types/node updates ([#1436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1436), [#1435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1435))
- **Flake ecosystem discussion** around automated Nix updates with community debate on testing requirements for automated flake lock updates ([#1430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1430))
repositories.discussions_summary: Question raised about reusing private lsp-fiber package for end-to-end testing in custom language servers
repositories.notable_discussions: - **End-to-end testing infrastructure** inquiry by [Kento Okura](https://github.com/kentookura) seeking guidance on implementing e2e testing for custom language servers using the private lsp-fiber package ([#1438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1438))
repositories.trends_summary: Pattern of automated dependency management with regular Nix flake and Node.js ecosystem updates requiring manual intervention
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Automated dependency workflows** showing consistent pattern of bot-generated PRs requiring manual testing and intervention when CI fails
- **Nix ecosystem integration** with regular flake lock updates and community discussion around automation reliability ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1437), [#1430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1430))
repositories.contributors_summary: Bot activity by GitHub Actions and Dependabot for dependency updates, plus user inquiry about testing infrastructure
repositories.contributors:
- [Kento Okura](https://github.com/kentookura) opened issue requesting guidance on implementing end-to-end testing for custom language servers ([#1438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1438))
- [@github-actions](https://github.com/github-actions) automated Nix flake lock file updates with Merlin and nixpkgs dependency bumps ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1437))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) submitted multiple Node.js type definition updates and @swc/core version bumps ([#1436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1436), [#1435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1435), [#1434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1434), [#1432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1432))

repositories.brief_summary: Ongoing discussion on atomic record fields RFC with implementation feedback
repositories.activity_summary: Discussion activity on atomic record fields RFC regarding inline records implementation challenges
repositories.activity: - Ongoing **atomic record fields RFC** discussion by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) with detailed feedback on implementation challenges, particularly regarding inline records which appear unusable with atomic fields ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39))
repositories.contributors_summary: Gabriel Scherer provided implementation feedback on atomic record fields RFC
repositories.contributors: - [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) shared detailed implementation feedback and conclusions about atomic field support in inline records, highlighting technical challenges with the current approach ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39))

repositories.brief_summary: Issue #95 reported `-package` argument recognition problem on loong64 platform affecting OCaml package builds
repositories.activity_summary: Single issue opened regarding bytecode platform compatibility on loong64 architecture
repositories.activity: - **Platform compatibility issue** reported by [wszqkzqk](https://github.com/wszqkzqk) affecting loong64 architecture where `-package` argument is not recognized by ocamlc, ocamldoc, and ocamldep tools ([#95](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/95))
repositories.contributors_summary: Single contributor opened issue about cross-platform compatibility
repositories.contributors: - [wszqkzqk](https://github.com/wszqkzqk) from Peking University and Arch Linux Loong64 team reported platform-specific issue affecting package builds on non-native bytecode platforms ([#95](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/95))

repositories.brief_summary: Tutorial improvements and new OCaml Planet content with one new enhancement issue opened
repositories.new_features_summary: Fixed tutorial typos and formatting in imperative programming guide
repositories.new_features:
- Fixed multiple **typos and formatting issues** in the "Mutability and Imperative Control Flow" tutorial including corrected function references and improved code examples [8d00f14](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/8d00f14f05956c2242e6fd11c0fb0b6a3b1a8a5f)
- Added **new OCaml Planet content** with automated blog post and video scraping bringing fresh community content to the site ([b536c3e](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/b536c3ec9a25e86aa9e8858be38911bf671a58b9), [2237005](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/2237005eabc7b270687dba9e6db07ea77af3f662))
repositories.activity_summary: One new enhancement issue opened for Windows compilation support
repositories.activity:
- **Windows compilation enhancement** opened by [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) seeking to enable ocaml.org compilation on Windows platform with build system improvements ([#2780](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2780))
- **Pull Request Template initiative** launched by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) to create contribution guidelines for OCaml Cookbook submissions ([#2904](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2904))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on improving contribution workflows and platform compatibility
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Platform compatibility efforts** with focus on Windows build support to expand OCaml.org accessibility across different operating systems ([#2780](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2780))
- **Documentation and tutorial maintenance** continues with regular content updates and correction of formatting issues in educational materials
- **Automated content curation** through OCaml Planet scraping bringing regular community blog posts and videos to keep the site current
repositories.issues_summary: One help-wanted issue available for Windows compilation work
repositories.good_first_issues: - **Windows compilation support** for ocaml.org marked as "help wanted" and "probably needs some guidance" - good opportunity to work on build system compatibility ([#2780](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2780))
repositories.contributors_summary: Three contributors involved in tutorial fixes, content curation, and enhancement planning
repositories.contributors:
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) opened the Windows compilation enhancement issue to improve platform support ([#2780](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2780))
- [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) initiated the Pull Request Template project for OCaml Cookbook contribution guidelines ([#2904](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2904))
- **Automated systems** handled OCaml Planet content scraping to bring new blog posts and videos to the community site

repositories.brief_summary: Major archival process removing unavailable packages plus 6 new package additions including batteries 3.9.0 and OCaml 5.3 compatibility fixes
repositories.new_features_summary: 6 new packages added including batteries 3.9.0, heroicons-reason-react 1.0, and 4 new releases for existing packages
repositories.new_features:
- **New batteries 3.9.0 release** with updated dependencies and compatibility improvements [9070e1af](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/9070e1af25cdf19f77098bc7c4c4d708e2795e14)
- **New heroicons-reason-react 1.0** providing ReasonML bindings to Heroicons React components [1436517a](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/1436517af43824c20e0793361b0b8304caeb1fa2)
- **New kdl 0.2.0 package** for KDL (Cuddly Document Language) parsing [e689aa98](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/e689aa987b5a08046fd5abb5d3cd36c1389cbb77)
- **New fileutils 0.6.6 release** with file manipulation utilities [dffef947](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/dffef947a1fd32163b04483a8616c3c771f542c4)
- **New xdg-basedir 0.0.5 release** for XDG Base Directory specification support [dce2a0d1](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/dce2a0d16c164076c43c1866e8d2d063455f529e)
- **New ott 0.34 package** for semantic definition tools [d188592c](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/d188592cb3b278b8b8cdebc5a37ea9606f1cb5f4)
- **New ansifmt 0.1.3 release** for ANSI formatting utilities [4f72a767](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/4f72a767e84080087c8dfff4ae8a793e205a992d)
- **New expect 0.1.0 release** for testing framework [1ae94722](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/1ae947223f8fb2d8f502c6c07097391306402f47)
- **New checked_oint 0.4.1 package** for checked integer operations [4e9883ef](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/4e9883ef012fa5e2459578e5f8a4cf1f9f3a9e46)
- **New ppx_minidebug 2.0.3 release** for debugging preprocessor [9633850e](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/9633850ecd71081733209434dd7e1a9197bf6296)
repositories.activity_summary: Major repository archival phase 1 removing 500+ unavailable packages, plus OCaml 5.3 compatibility fixes and package deprecation markings
repositories.activity:
- **Repository archival phase 1** completed by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) removing all unavailable packages to clean up the repository ([#27100](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27100), [1b4e0444](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/1b4e04443c3dcb6b96fd053fb6014c9e0a476dde))
- **OCaml 5.3 compatibility fixes** implemented across multiple packages including riot, miou, and frama-c to handle `effect` keyword changes ([cb391d60](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/cb391d6018dd7e8afadfe876c3b13cc38ce3c24f), [d070e55f](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/d070e55f401ad469d36713f327f79015a332008f), [4c29abfa](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/4c29abfae25804ed58f30b2f015a2dbf89a36f09))
- **Package deprecation markings** added for io-page-unix, tar-format, and functoria packages to signal maintenance status ([069fc9e2](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/069fc9e22a52db12aafdbf007c0e2203866d6442), [28baa1c4](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/28baa1c4bc6ffc162d8cdd68d44c2faf977f7e43), [53262a91](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/53262a911f9db7cb2382316a4289b267b67a7199))
- **Dependency constraint updates** including result package availability restrictions for OCaml < 4.08 and owl-plplot upper bounds ([c8565854](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/c856585c442c4032b02be6dbb9a41c28e2cdf4fa), [98aa76ea](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/98aa76eac5214e24404d4744a4ac72e41803c161))
- **Maintenance intent updates** for arrayjit and neural_nets_lib packages to indicate current development status ([21bc7056](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/21bc7056238c76643c3bb3124779640acb909e77))
- **Base-flambda package revival** to support malfunction dependencies ([f53a621b](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/f53a621b4d526e0b11cfd4249960e0bedd76721a))
repositories.trends_summary: Repository maintenance focus with large-scale archival process and proactive OCaml 5.3 compatibility preparations
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Large-scale repository cleanup** through systematic archival of unavailable packages to improve repository health and reduce maintenance burden
- **Proactive OCaml 5.3 compatibility** work addressing language changes, particularly the `effect` keyword becoming reserved
- **Package deprecation strategy** using standardized deprecation markings to signal maintenance status to users
- **Maintenance transparency** through explicit maintenance intent declarations in package metadata
repositories.issues_summary: 4 archival-related issues resolved addressing broken package sources and checksums from discontinued services
repositories.contributors_summary: Repository maintenance led by Hannes Mehnert with policy discussions by Etienne Millon and issue reporting by community members
repositories.contributors:
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) coordinated the major repository archival phase 1 ([#27100](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27100)) and resolved multiple archival-related issues ([#27186](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27186), [#23587](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/23587), [#19757](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/19757), [#15298](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/15298), [#12421](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/12421))
- [Etienne Millon](https://github.com/emillon) led ongoing policy discussions for handling non-functional packages in the repository ([#23697](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/23697))
- [Sita Ganesh](https://github.com/SitaGanesh) reported Windows installation issues that were identified as duplicate and resolved through archival process ([#27186](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27186))
- Multiple package maintainers contributed new releases including batteries, heroicons-reason-react, kdl, fileutils, xdg-basedir, ott, ansifmt, expect, checked_oint, and ppx_minidebug

repositories.brief_summary: Major runtime improvements with continuation efficiency optimizations and updated ECMAScript compatibility documentation
repositories.new_features_summary: Continuation resumption performance improvements and modernized runtime standard library implementation
repositories.new_features:
- **Continuation efficiency** improvements with new `caml_reperform_effect` function for optimized effect resumption in JavaScript runtime ([64f4619](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/64f4619f505756636795d271e18935da9cafbc51))
- **Runtime modernization** removing legacy `stdlib_modern.js` and consolidating standard library implementation ([e734c249](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/e734c249f82422c0f259660864a466a5275f2e5d))
- **Biome linting** expanded to check additional file types for improved code quality ([822ec2b6](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/822ec2b6763bee4fd8c686f2f8194f03c5dfe744))
- **ECMAScript compatibility** documentation created specifying required ES2015+ features and Node.js requirements ([09e9842a](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/09e9842ac4d82371619f79bf6438e76b0f4d8260))
repositories.activity_summary: New draft PR opened for version management simplification and continuation efficiency issue closed
repositories.activity:
- **Draft PR opened** by [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) for using `dune-build-info` to simplify version management across packages ([#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1783))
- **Continuation efficiency** feature request completed with [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) creating WASM-specific follow-up ([#1779](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1779)) after [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) closed original request ([#1658](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1658))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on runtime performance and development tooling improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Performance optimization** focus with continuation efficiency improvements affecting effect handlers and runtime performance
- **Development infrastructure** modernization through updated GitHub Actions workflows and expanded code quality checks
- **Documentation clarity** with new ECMAScript compatibility requirements clearly specified for users and contributors
repositories.contributors_summary: Three contributors active with runtime improvements, tooling updates, and version management work
repositories.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) implemented continuation efficiency improvements ([#1765](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1765)) and runtime modernization ([#1764](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1764)), plus closed the original continuation efficiency feature request ([#1658](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1658))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) created WASM-specific continuation efficiency feature request ([#1779](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1779)) and contributed to biome linting expansion ([#1778](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1778)) and ECMAScript documentation ([#1780](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1780))
- [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) opened draft PR for version management simplification using `dune-build-info` ([#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1783)) and contributed to GitHub Actions workflow updates

repositories.brief_summary: Discussion continued on domain manager coordination for multi-domain applications
repositories.activity_summary: Issue discussion about domain manager coordination with prototype development
repositories.activity: - **Domain manager coordination** discussion continued by [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) with detailed prototype implementation for automatic multi-domain task execution and parallelized task runner ([#791](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/791))
repositories.contributors_summary: Yawar Amin advanced domain manager coordination with prototype implementation
repositories.contributors: - [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) provided detailed prototype implementation for domain coordination including parallelized task runner with divide-and-conquer algorithm and float array summation example ([#791](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/791))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major opam-repository archival removing 500+ packages and new package additions alongside ocaml.org tutorial improvements
group_summaries.new_features_summary: 9 new packages added to opam-repository plus ocaml.org tutorial fixes and automated content updates
group_summaries.new_features:
- **New batteries 3.9.0 release** with updated dependencies and compatibility improvements in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) ([9070e1af](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/9070e1af25cdf19f77098bc7c4c4d708e2795e14))
- **New heroicons-reason-react 1.0** providing ReasonML bindings to Heroicons React components ([1436517a](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/1436517af43824c20e0793361b0b8304caeb1fa2))
- **New kdl 0.2.0 package** for KDL (Cuddly Document Language) parsing ([e689aa98](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/e689aa987b5a08046fd5abb5d3cd36c1389cbb77))
- **Fixed tutorial typos and formatting** in the "Mutability and Imperative Control Flow" tutorial on [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) ([8d00f14](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/8d00f14f05956c2242e6fd11c0fb0b6a3b1a8a5f))
- **Additional new packages** including fileutils 0.6.6, xdg-basedir 0.0.5, ott 0.34, ansifmt 0.1.3, expect 0.1.0, checked_oint 0.4.1, and ppx_minidebug 2.0.3
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Repository maintenance focus** with [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) completing phase 1 of major archival process removing 500+ unavailable packages ([#27100](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27100))
- **New package additions** bringing 9 new releases including batteries 3.9.0, heroicons-reason-react 1.0, and kdl 0.2.0 to expand OCaml ecosystem
- **Platform compatibility improvements** with [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) focusing on Windows build support ([#2780](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2780)) and tutorial documentation maintenance
- **OCaml 5.3 preparation** across multiple packages addressing language changes, particularly the `effect` keyword becoming reserved
- **Community content updates** through automated OCaml Planet scraping bringing fresh blog posts and videos to [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org)
group_summaries.activity_summary: Repository archival, OCaml 5.3 compatibility fixes, Windows platform support planning, and contribution workflow improvements
group_summaries.activity:
- **Major repository archival phase 1** led by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) removing all unavailable packages from [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) ([#27100](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27100))
- **OCaml 5.3 compatibility fixes** implemented across riot, miou, and frama-c packages to handle `effect` keyword changes ([cb391d60](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/cb391d6018dd7e8afadfe876c3b13cc38ce3c24f))
- **Package deprecation strategy** with standardized markings for io-page-unix, tar-format, and functoria packages ([069fc9e2](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/069fc9e22a52db12aafdbf007c0e2203866d6442))
- **Windows compilation enhancement** opened by [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) for [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) platform support ([#2780](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2780))
- **Pull Request Template initiative** by [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) for OCaml Cookbook contribution guidelines ([#2904](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2904))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Platform compatibility focus** with both repositories working on Windows support - [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) resolving Windows installation issues ([#27186](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27186)) while [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) seeks Windows compilation capability ([#2780](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2780))
- **OCaml language evolution preparation** with [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) proactively fixing OCaml 5.3 compatibility across multiple packages while [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) maintains current tutorial content
- **Community onboarding improvements** with [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) policy discussions for package maintenance ([#23697](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/23697)) and [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) developing contribution templates ([#2904](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2904))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Large-scale repository maintenance** through systematic archival of unavailable packages in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) to improve ecosystem health ([#27100](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27100))
- **Proactive OCaml 5.3 compatibility** work addressing upcoming language changes, particularly the `effect` keyword becoming reserved across multiple packages
- **Cross-platform accessibility** with focused efforts on Windows support across both [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) and [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) repositories
- **Contribution workflow standardization** through package deprecation markings in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) and PR templates in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) ([#2904](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2904))
- **Automated content curation** maintaining fresh community content through OCaml Planet integration on [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org)

group_summaries.brief_summary: Limited activity with js_of_ocaml runtime improvements and maintenance work on ocaml-lsp and ocamlfind
group_summaries.new_features_summary: JavaScript runtime performance improvements and continuation efficiency optimizations in js_of_ocaml
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Continuation efficiency** improvements with new `caml_reperform_effect` function for optimized effect resumption in JavaScript runtime ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml@64f4619](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/64f4619f505756636795d271e18935da9cafbc51))
- **Runtime modernization** removing legacy `stdlib_modern.js` and consolidating standard library implementation ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml@e734c249](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/e734c249f82422c0f259660864a466a5275f2e5d))
- **ECMAScript compatibility** documentation created specifying required ES2015+ features and Node.js requirements ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml@09e9842a](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/09e9842ac4d82371619f79bf6438e76b0f4d8260))
- **Biome linting** expanded to check additional file types for improved code quality ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml@822ec2b6](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/822ec2b6763bee4fd8c686f2f8194f03c5dfe744))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Limited activity** across 9 repositories with only 3 showing meaningful development work during the holiday week
- **JavaScript runtime focus** with [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) receiving major performance improvements and modernization
- **Platform compatibility** issues surfaced in [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind) affecting loong64 architecture builds
- **Dependency maintenance** dominated [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) activity with multiple automated PRs
- **Core tools** ([ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune), [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin), [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc), [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam), [ocaml/opam-file-format](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-file-format), [ocaml-dune/spawn](https://github.com/ocaml-dune/spawn)) showed no activity
group_summaries.activity_summary: Maintenance-heavy week with dependency updates, platform issue reporting, and version management work
group_summaries.activity:
- **Platform compatibility** issue reported by [wszqkzqk](https://github.com/wszqkzqk) affecting loong64 architecture where `-package` argument is not recognized by ocamlc, ocamldep, and ocamldoc tools ([ocaml/ocamlfind#95](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/95))
- **Automated dependency updates** dominated [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) with four new PRs from [@github-actions](https://github.com/github-actions) for Nix flake updates ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1437)) and [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) for Node.js type definitions ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1436), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1435), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1434), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1432))
- **Version management** work initiated by [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) with draft PR for using `dune-build-info` to simplify version management across [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) packages ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1783))
- **Continuation efficiency** feature request completed with [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) closing original request ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1658](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1658)) after implementation, followed by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) creating WASM-specific follow-up ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1779](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1779))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **End-to-end testing infrastructure** inquiry by [Kento Okura](https://github.com/kentookura) seeking guidance on implementing e2e testing for custom language servers using the private lsp-fiber package ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1438))
- **Nix flake automation** discussion around testing requirements for automated flake lock updates with community debate on automation reliability ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1430))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Automated dependency management** patterns showing consistent bot-generated PRs requiring manual intervention when CI fails across Node.js and Nix ecosystems
- **Performance optimization** focus with continuation efficiency improvements in JavaScript runtime affecting effect handlers
- **Cross-platform compatibility** concerns emerging with specific architecture support issues in foundational tools like [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind)
- **Development infrastructure** modernization through updated tooling, expanded code quality checks, and improved documentation

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major internal language improvements with symbol mangling overhaul, Unicode support, Bool module enhancements, and RFC implementation discussions
group_summaries.new_features_summary: New Bool logical functions, Unicode identifier support in comments, and improved symbol name mangling consistency
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Symbol mangling overhaul** changes module names from `camlModule.name_NNN` to `camlModule$name_NNN` with consistent platform encoding ([ocaml/ocaml@ccbd123a](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/ccbd123a82e59c710f36097c37b269d4cbbf7c20))
- **Unicode identifier support** in comments allows proper rendering of unicode characters in documentation and code comments ([ocaml/ocaml@385ab8f9](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/385ab8f9b9ad8d8dc53a7d2777e35533fc6c93fa), [ocaml/ocaml@ccbd123a](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/ccbd123a82e59c710f36097c37b269d4cbbf7c20))
- **Bool module enhancements** with new logical functions `logand`, `logor`, and `logxor` providing explicit Boolean operations ([ocaml/ocaml@d2367511](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d23675111673018c5cf51ee07a51df181128df3d))
- **OCaml frame pointer correctness** improvements when using C libraries that don't support frame pointers ([ocaml/ocaml@d2367511](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d23675111673018c5cf51ee07a51df181128df3d))
- **Continuation optimization** with faster `caml_continuation_use_and_update_handler_noexc` implementation ([ocaml/ocaml@fbe9cedf](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/fbe9cedf020ceedbfc777977fe86346dcec289ff))
- **AMD64 register stall fix** avoiding conversion instruction stalls on amd64 architecture ([ocaml/ocaml@d2367511](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d23675111673018c5cf51ee07a51df181128df3d))
- **Cross-compilation support** enhancements with new GitHub workflow for cross-platform builds ([ocaml/ocaml@d2367511](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d23675111673018c5cf51ee07a51df181128df3d))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Core language development** concentrated on internal improvements and platform consistency across [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with major symbol mangling changes
- **RFC implementation feedback** provided by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) on atomic record fields challenges in [ocaml/RFCs#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39)
- **Unicode modernization** progressing with comment identifier support and updated documentation across the language
- **Windows compatibility** addressed through [ocaml/ocaml#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704) reporting runtop-with-otherlibs issues
- **Performance optimizations** implemented in continuation handling and AMD64 register allocation
group_summaries.activity_summary: Core repository focused on internal improvements while RFCs repository saw implementation feedback discussions
group_summaries.activity:
- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) opened issue about **Windows runtop-with-otherlibs** failing to load otherlibs with Unix module giving "dynamic loading not supported" error ([ocaml/ocaml#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704))
- **Extensive typing system improvements** merged with labeled argument additions to typemod functions by multiple contributors ([ocaml/ocaml@d75d775e](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d75d775e0c15bddb2b42685c144abefeeb38012f), [ocaml/ocaml@85970ee1](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/85970ee160c13baa89d904dabb00266eb08dc088))
- **Build system modernization** with updated autotools configuration and improved cross-compilation support ([ocaml/ocaml@d2367511](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d23675111673018c5cf51ee07a51df181128df3d))
- **Test suite expansion** including new frame pointer tests, Unicode comment tests, and debugger reference updates ([ocaml/ocaml@ccbd123a](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/ccbd123a82e59c710f36097c37b269d4cbbf7c20), [ocaml/ocaml@385ab8f9](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/385ab8f9b9ad8d8dc53a7d2777e35533fc6c93fa))
- **Atomic record fields RFC** discussion by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) with detailed feedback on implementation challenges, particularly regarding inline records which appear unusable with atomic fields ([ocaml/RFCs#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Implementation feedback loop** between [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) atomic record fields proposal and [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) implementation reality, with [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) providing detailed analysis in [ocaml/RFCs#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39)
- **Coordinated development** by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) contributing to both typing system improvements in the main repository and RFC implementation feedback
- **Technical constraint identification** where RFC proposals face implementation challenges that require cross-repository coordination to resolve
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Atomic record fields implementation challenges** discussed by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) highlighting technical issues with inline records and atomic field support ([ocaml/RFCs#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39))
- **Windows dynamic loading limitations** raised by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) affecting runtop-with-otherlibs functionality on mingw32 and MSVC targets ([ocaml/ocaml#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Platform standardization** with consistent symbol mangling across all platforms moving away from platform-specific naming schemes in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml)
- **Unicode modernization** progressing with support for Unicode identifiers in comments and updated documentation ([ocaml/ocaml@385ab8f9](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/385ab8f9b9ad8d8dc53a7d2777e35533fc6c93fa))
- **Windows compatibility focus** addressing longstanding issues with dynamic loading and otherlibs functionality ([ocaml/ocaml#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704))
- **Performance optimization** continuing with targeted improvements in continuation handling and register allocation ([ocaml/ocaml@fbe9cedf](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/fbe9cedf020ceedbfc777977fe86346dcec289ff))
- **Type system refinements** with ongoing work on labeled arguments and internal typing infrastructure ([ocaml/ocaml@85970ee1](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/85970ee160c13baa89d904dabb00266eb08dc088))
- **RFC implementation validation** with closer integration between proposal discussions and actual implementation constraints ([ocaml/RFCs#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Domain manager coordination discussion progressed in eio with prototype implementation
group_summaries.group_overview:
- Limited activity across the multicore group during the first week of 2025
- Only [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) showed development activity
- Eight repositories remained inactive: [ocaml-multicore/domainslib](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/domainslib), [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring), [ocaml-multicore/meio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/meio), [ocaml-multicore/saturn](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn), [ocaml-multicore/eio-trace](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio-trace), [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos), [ocaml-multicore/kcas](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/kcas), and [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-iomux](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-iomux)
group_summaries.activity_summary: Domain manager coordination discussion advanced with detailed prototype implementation
group_summaries.activity: - **Domain manager coordination** discussion continued by [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) with detailed prototype implementation for automatic multi-domain task execution and parallelized task runner ([ocaml-multicore/eio#791](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/791))
group_summaries.notable_discussions: - **Multi-domain task execution architecture** discussion featuring divide-and-conquer algorithms and float array summation examples in [ocaml-multicore/eio#791](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/791)
group_summaries.emerging_trends: - **Multi-domain parallelization focus** with prototype implementations targeting automatic task distribution across domains

weekly_summary.group_overview:
- __RUMINANT:core__ focused on **internal language improvements** with major symbol mangling changes across [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml), Unicode modernization in documentation, and RFC implementation feedback discussions while addressing Windows compatibility issues
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ showed **minimal activity** with only [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) receiving development work on domain manager coordination discussions during the holiday week
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ executed **major repository maintenance** including a phase 1 archival removing 500+ unavailable packages from [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) while adding 9 new package releases and improving Windows platform support
- __RUMINANT:tools__ delivered **JavaScript runtime improvements** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) with continuation efficiency optimizations while most other tools repositories remained inactive during the holiday period
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ had **no development activity** with all repositories showing null summary data during the first week of 2025

core: -focused on **internal language improvements** with major symbol mangling changes across [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml), Unicode modernization in documentation, and RFC implementation feedback discussions while addressing Windows compatibility issues
tools: -delivered **JavaScript runtime improvements** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) with continuation efficiency optimizations while most other tools repositories remained inactive during the holiday period
ecosystem: -executed **major repository maintenance** including a phase 1 archival removing 500+ unavailable packages from [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) while adding 9 new package releases and improving Windows platform support
oxcaml: -had **no development activity** with all repositories showing null summary data during the first week of 2025
multicore: -showed **minimal activity** with only [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) receiving development work on domain manager coordination discussions during the holiday week

weekly_summary.activity_summary: Repository archival completion, Windows compatibility fixes, typing system improvements, dependency maintenance, and multicore design discussions

- __RUMINANT:core__ [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) opened issue about **Windows runtop-with-otherlibs** failing to load otherlibs with Unix module giving "dynamic loading not supported" error ([ocaml/ocaml#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704))

weekly_summary.cross_repository_work:
- **Windows platform compatibility** efforts spanning both [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) resolving Windows installation issues ([ocaml/opam-repository#27186](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27186)) and [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) seeking Windows compilation capability ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2780](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2780))
- **OCaml language evolution preparation** with [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) proactively fixing OCaml 5.3 compatibility across multiple packages while [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) maintains current tutorial content
- **Implementation feedback loop** between [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) atomic record fields proposal and [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) implementation reality, with [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) providing detailed analysis in [ocaml/RFCs#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39)
- **Community onboarding improvements** with [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) policy discussions for package maintenance and [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) developing contribution templates through [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) initiatives ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2904](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2904))
weekly_summary.notable_discussions:
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Atomic record fields implementation challenges** discussed by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) highlighting technical issues with inline records and atomic field support, particularly regarding inline records which appear unusable with atomic fields ([ocaml/RFCs#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39))
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Windows dynamic loading limitations** raised by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) affecting runtop-with-otherlibs functionality on mingw32 and MSVC targets ([ocaml/ocaml#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704))
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **Multi-domain task execution architecture** discussion featuring divide-and-conquer algorithms and float array summation examples in [ocaml-multicore/eio#791](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/791)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **End-to-end testing infrastructure** inquiry by [Kento Okura](https://github.com/kentookura) seeking guidance on implementing e2e testing for custom language servers using the private lsp-fiber package ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1438))
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Nix flake automation** discussion around testing requirements for automated flake lock updates with community debate on automation reliability ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1430))

weekly_summary.emerging_trends:
- **Platform standardization** with consistent symbol mangling across all platforms moving away from platform-specific naming schemes in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml), reflecting broader ecosystem modernization efforts
- **Unicode modernization** progressing with support for Unicode identifiers in comments and updated documentation ([ocaml/ocaml@385ab8f9](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/385ab8f9b9ad8d8dc53a7d2777e35533fc6c93fa)), indicating international accessibility improvements
- **Automated dependency management** patterns showing consistent bot-generated PRs requiring manual intervention when CI fails across Node.js and Nix ecosystems, demonstrating infrastructure automation maturity
- **Large-scale repository maintenance** through systematic archival of unavailable packages in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) to improve ecosystem health ([ocaml/opam-repository#27100](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27100))
- **Proactive OCaml 5.3 compatibility** work addressing upcoming language changes, particularly the `effect` keyword becoming reserved across multiple packages, showing forward-thinking ecosystem management
- **Cross-platform accessibility** with focused efforts on Windows support across both [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) and [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) repositories
- **RFC implementation validation** with closer integration between proposal discussions and actual implementation constraints ([ocaml/RFCs#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39)), improving the design feedback loop
- **Multi-domain parallelization focus** with prototype implementations targeting automatic task distribution across domains in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio)
